intro: Diplotaxis siifolia, commonly known as African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Diplotaxis siifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
